info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 5:06AM CST until November 20 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Southern and Eastern Dallas County
* WHEN...Until 700 AM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Rowlett, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Lancaster, Balch Springs, Seagoville, Glenn Heights, Highland Park, Hutchins, Cockrell Hill, Sunnyvale, Wilmer, Ovilla, Ferris and Combine.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING
